definitions.definition: regard as probable; expect or predict.
examples: she anticipated scorn on her return to the theater
synonyms: reckon on; informalfigure on "we don't anticipate any trouble"

definitions.definition: guess or be aware of (what will happen) and take action in order to be prepared.
examples: they failed to anticipate a full scale invasion
synonyms: second-guess; informalbeat someone to the punch "the defender must anticipate the attacker's moves"

examples: Stephen was eagerly anticipating the break from the routine of business
synonyms: count the days until; informallick one's lips over "we enthusiastically anticipate your arrival"

definitions.definition: act as a forerunner or precursor of.
examples: he anticipated Bates's theories on mimicry and protective coloration

definitions.definition: come or take place before (an event or process expected or scheduled for a later time).
react or respond to (someone) too quickly, without giving them a chance to do or say something.
pay (a debt) before it is due.
